titles: By the Major. Whereas it is made known to my self, the aldermen, and commons in Common-councell assembled, by a letter received from his excellency the Lord Fairfax, that his Lordship for the preventing of the quartering of his army in the city, doth require, that a present supply of money may be paid for the use of the army, ...
author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor.
Reynardson, Abraham, Sir, 1590-1661.
publisher: Printed by Richard Cotes, Printer to the Honourable City of London,
notes: Place of publication conjectured from printer's reported city of operation.
Dated at end of document: at the Guild-hall London, this second day of December, 1648.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Militia --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
